help.title: Help Center
help.intro: Welcome! Here you'll find guides on how to use the features of Business Hub.

dashboard.title: Main Dashboard
dashboard.content:
The Dashboard is your home screen, designed to provide a quick overview of your business's most important information.

Key Components:

  • Stat Cards: At the top, you'll see key numbers like total active customers, suppliers, and your upcoming appointments. These cards serve as a daily pulse check on your operation.
  • New Customers Chart: This chart shows the growth of your customer base over the past few months, allowing you to identify acquisition trends.
  • Upcoming Appointments List: A quick summary of your next scheduled events for the day, ensuring you never miss an important meeting.

customers.title: Managing Customers
customers.content:
Viewing the Customer List

On this screen, you'll see a table with all your customers. Use the search bar at the top to find a specific customer by name.

Adding a New Customer

  1. Click the blue \"+ Add Customer\" button in the top right corner.
  2. Fill out the form. The system automatically validates the DNI/CUIT to ensure data integrity.
  3. For individual customers, you can choose a predefined avatar or upload a photo.
  4. After filling it out, click \"Add Customer\" to save.

Viewing Details and Interactions

  • Click on any customer in the list to open a window with their complete details.
  • Navigate to the \"Interactions\" tab to see the entire history of contacts, such as calls, emails, and meetings.
  • You can log a new interaction directly on this tab.

AI Analysis

On the interactions tab, if there's a history of contacts, you can use the \"Analyze with AI\" button. The artificial intelligence will read the interactions and generate a strategic summary, identifying customer sentiment, business opportunities, and suggesting next steps.

suppliers.title: Managing Suppliers
suppliers.content:
Supplier management is centralized on this screen, working very similarly to customer management. You can register partners, contact information, and the services they provide.

  • Use the \"+ Add Supplier\" button to register a new partner.
  • Fill in the company data as well as the information for the main contact person.
  • You can view, edit, or remove a supplier using the icons in the list.

agenda.title: Using the Agenda
agenda.content:
Agenda Views

The agenda offers multiple ways to view your appointments. Use the buttons in the top right corner to switch between views:

  • Board (Kanban): Ideal for weekly planning. Organize appointments into columns like \"Today\", \"Tomorrow\", and \"Next 7 Days\". Drag and drop cards to reschedule appointments intuitively.
  • List: A chronological view of all your future appointments.
  • Month, Week, Day: Classic calendar views for short and long-term planning.

Creating and Managing Appointments

  1. Click the \"+ New Appointment\" button.
  2. Fill in details like title, description, start and end date/time.
  3. Associate appointments with customers or suppliers to maintain an integrated history.
  4. Attach important files and set up recurrences for regular events (daily, weekly, etc.).
  5. Mark an appointment as completed directly on the board or in the list.
  6. Add subtasks to detail activities. Mark them as complete and track progress with visual indicators on the board and a progress bar in the detail view.

History and AI Summary

Access the \"History\" to see all completed appointments. For any appointment in the history, click \"AI Summary\". The system will generate a professional summary of the meeting, ideal for minutes and follow-ups.

reports.title: Reports and Exports
reports.content:
This section allows you to view consolidated data and export it for use in other tools or for presentations.

  • Navigate Tabs: Choose between reports for Appointments, Customers, Suppliers, or Activity Log.
  • Filter Data: In each report, you can use filters, such as date ranges, to focus on the data that matters most.
  • Export to PDF or Excel: For each report, you will find buttons to \"Export PDF\" (great for printing and sharing) and \"Export Excel\" (ideal if you need to manipulate the data in spreadsheets).

settings.title: Settings
settings.content:
Customize the system to meet the needs of your team and company.

  • My Company: Update your company's registration details, such as address, phone, and Tax ID.
  • Users: Add new team members to the system, edit their information, and set their permissions (Administrator, Manager, Collaborator).
  • Categories: Customize appointment categories. You can rename, change icons and colors to better suit your organization.
  • Companies (Super Admin): If you are a super administrator, you will see an additional tab to manage all companies registered in the system.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
faq.q1: What do I do if I forget my password?
faq.a1: Currently, password recovery is not yet automated. Please contact the system administrator in your company to request a new temporary password.
faq.q2: Can I use the system on my phone or tablet?
faq.a2: Yes! \"Business Hub Pro\" was designed to be responsive, meaning it adapts to different screen sizes. The experience may be slightly different, but all main features will be available.
faq.q3: How does the top search bar work?
faq.a3: The search bar at the top of the screen is a powerful tool. Start typing the name of a customer, supplier, or the title of an appointment, and the results will appear automatically. Clicking a result will take you directly to the corresponding page.
faq.q4: What does the notification bell show?
faq.a4: The bell icon shows a number representing how many appointments you have scheduled for the rest of today. Clicking it opens a quick list of these appointments.
